thread.title: NCAA Football TV schedule with announcers: Mowins at Nebraska; Millen at Illinois; Herbstreit at Rutgers

author: Keith Groller
title: NCAA Football TV schedule with announcers: Mowins at Nebraska; Millen at Illinois; Herbstreit at Rutgers
text:
NCAA Football TV schedule with announcers: Mowins at Nebraska; Millen at Illinois; Herbstreit at Rutgers NCAA Football: Maryland at Penn State Rich Barnes / USA Today Sports Nov 1, 2014; University Park, PA, USA; Penn State Nittany Lions quarterback Christian Hackenberg (14) is sacked by Maryland Terrapins defensive lineman Andre Monroe (93) during the first quarter at Beaver Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Rich Barnes-USA TODAY Sports ORG XMIT: USATSI-182384 Nov 1, 2014; University Park, PA, USA; Penn State Nittany Lions quarterback Christian Hackenberg (14) is sacked by Maryland Terrapins defensive lineman Andre Monroe (93) during the first quarter at Beaver Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Rich Barnes-USA TODAY Sports ORG XMIT: USATSI-182384 (Rich Barnes / USA Today Sports) Keith Groller Contact Reporter Of The Morning Call 
The Big Ten Conference will get its Lion's share of attention this Saturday. 
ABC's top crew, featuring Chris Fowler, Kirk Herbstreit and Heather Cox will have the primetime game between Ohio State and Rutgers in New Jersey. That's an 8 p.m. start. 
Earlier in the day, Lafayette College graduate Beth Mowins will have the play-by-play on the Northwestern at Nebraska game at noon on ESPN2. 
Whitehall High graduate Matt Millen will have the color analysis of the Wisconsin at Illinois game at 3:30 on the Big Ten Network. That game is going head-to-head with the Penn State-Maryland game on ESPN, which will feature Dave LaMont and Ray Bentley as the announcers. 
Bentley, a former NFL linebacker, is also a former teammate of Andre Reed, having played on the first two Bills Super Bowl teams in the 1990s. 
Also, the No. 1 CBS team of Verne Lundquist and Gary Danielson, which always has the top SEC game, will have the Tennessee-Alabama game at 3:30. 
And my weekly "Where's Brent?" nugget? Veteran Brent Musburger will have the call on the Kentucky-Mississippi State game on the SEC Network. 
Here's the complete listing of games and announcers courtesy of the National Football Foundation: 
The American
